data.enText: the series of events which form the story of a novel, play, film/movie, etc.
a conventional plot about love and marriage

data.chText: 这本书的故事布局十分严谨。
data.enText: The book is well organized in terms of plot.
a secret plan made by a group of people to do sth wrong or illegal
a small piece of land that is used or intended for a special purpose

data.chText: 她买了一小块地盖房子。
data.enText: She bought a small plot of land to build a house on.
a vegetable plot
lose the plot
to lose your ability to understand or deal with what is happening
the plot thickens
used to say that a situation is becoming more complicated and difficult to understand
to make a secret plan to harm sb, especially a government or its leader
They were accused of plotting against the state.

data.chText: 人们怀疑军方在策划政变。
data.enText: Military officers were suspected of plotting a coup.
They were plotting to overthrow the government.
to mark sth on a map, for example the position or course of sth

data.chText: 地震震中均被标示在一张世界地图上。
data.enText: The earthquake centres had been plotted on a world map.
to make a diagram or chart from some information

data.chText: 我们仔细绘出了每个病人对这种药物反应的图表。
data.enText: We carefully plotted each patient's response to the drug on a chart.
to mark points on a graph and draw a line or curve connecting them

data.chText: 首先，在图表上绘出温度曲线来。
data.enText: First, plot the temperature curve on the graph.

data.chText: （为小说、戏剧等）设计情节；布局
data.enText: to write the plot of a novel, play, etc.

data.chText: 情节丝丝入扣的惊险刺激小说
data.enText: a tightly-plotted thriller

data.chText: 以上各词均指作特定用途的土地。
data.enText: These words all mean an area of land that is used for a particular purpose.
land

data.chText: 尤指作特定用途的土地、地带：
data.enText: an area of ground, especially one that is used for a particular purpose
agricultural land
lot

data.chText: 指作某种用途的一块地、场地：
data.enText: ( NAmE ) a piece of land that is used or intended for a particular purpose
building lots
a parking lot
ground
an area of land that is used for a particular purpose

data.chText: 孩子们在学校附近的荒地玩耍。
data.enText: The kids were playing on waste ground near the school.
the site of an ancient burial ground

data.chText: land用以指乡间广阔的土地，尤指农业用地；lot常指城镇或城市中的一小块地，尤指专用的建筑或停车场地；ground作不可数名词指任何开阔地、空旷地，作可数名词指特定用途或活动的场地。
data.enText: Land is used for large areas of open land in the country, especially when it is used for farming. A lot is often a smaller piece of land in a town or city, especially one intended for building or parking on. Ground is any area of open land; a ground is an area of land designed or used for a particular purpose or activity.
land, lot or ground?
space

data.chText: 指无建筑物的大片空地、开阔地：
data.enText: a large area of land that has no buildings on it

data.chText: 这座城市有很多开阔的空地。
data.enText: The city has plenty of open space.

data.chText: 加拿大一片片广袤的草原
data.enText: the wide open spaces of the Canadian prairies
plot
a small piece of land used or intended for a particular purpose

data.chText: 她买了一小块地盖房子。
data.enText: She bought a small plot of land to build a house.
a vegetable plot

data.chText: lot和plot均可作建筑用地。plot亦可作菜地或墓地。
data.enText: Either a lot or a plot can be used for building on. Only a plot can also be used for growing vegetables or burying people.
lot or plot?
(an) open land/ground/space
(a/an) empty/vacant/unused/derelict land/lot/ground/plot
waste land/ground
a burial plot

ex.enText: There is a herb garden behind the house.

ex.chText: 我们园子里的郁金香已经盛开。
ex.enText: The tulips in our garden are in bloom now.

synonyms.bx: 指屋子旁边种花、草等植物的园地。

ex.chText: 我们租了一小块土地种蔬菜。
ex.enText: We rented a small allotment of land to grow vegetables.

synonyms.bx: 指地方政府划成小块出租的土地，专供人们种蔬菜用。

ex.chText: 一小块卷心菜/草莓/蔬菜地

synonyms.bx: 指用于种水果和蔬菜的小片土地。

ex.chText: 他们有一块供盖房用的地皮。
ex.enText: They have a plot for building a house.
I hope to have a vegetable plot.

synonyms.bx: 指供建筑或种植用的小块地皮。

ex.enText: Where do you plan to spend your holiday?

ex.chText: 数月来，我们一直在筹划我们的加拿大之行。
ex.enText: We have been planning our trip to Canada for months.

ex.chText: 警方正在调查他何时开始计划逃跑以及他的同谋有谁。
ex.enText: The police are investigating when he began planning his escape and who his accomplices were.

ex.chText: 他不是蓄意隐瞒真相的，只是一时害怕。
ex.enText: He didn't plan to conceal the truth. He was just too scared at that moment.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指事前仔细筹划、安排。

ex.enText: They had plotted to rob the bank.

ex.chText: 为什么军方密谋推翻他？
ex.enText: Why did the military secretly plot against him?
He plotted to overthrow the government.

synonyms.bx: 通常指秘密策划违法行为或针对某政要、政府的阴谋活动。

ex.chText: 学生们想要更多的时间来准备考试。
ex.enText: The students wanted more time to prepare their exams.

ex.chText: 他们正忙着准备去度蜜月。
ex.enText: They were busy preparing for their honeymoon.

synonyms.bx: 指为将要发生的事情作好计划、安排等。

ex.chText: 会议定于下星期五召开。
ex.enText: The conference is scheduled for next Friday.

ex.chText: 他的第一本书定于10月出版。
ex.enText: His first book is scheduled for publication in October.

synonyms.bx: 指将某事安排在某一时间或日期进行，通常用被动语态。

ex.chText: 邪恶的皇后密谋毒死小公主。
ex.enText: The evil queen schemed to kill the little princess with poison.

ex.chText: 他总是觉得他的同事们都在算计他。
ex.enText: He always feels that all his colleagues are scheming against him.

synonyms.bx: 指为牟取私利而投机取巧或搞阴谋。

data.enText: lose the plot
to lose your ability to understand or deal with what is happening
the plot thickens
used to say that a situation is becoming more complicated and difficult to understand

tr: a secret scheme to do something (especially something underhand or illegal)
example: they concocted a plot to discredit the governor
I saw through his little game from the start

tr: the story that is told in a novel or play or movie etc.
example: the characters were well drawn but the plot was banal

tr: a chart or map showing the movements or progress of an object
a small area of ground covered by specific vegetation

example: They plotted the overthrow of the government

tr: devise the sequence of events in (a literary work or a play, movie, or ballet)
example: the writer is plotting a new novel

tr: make a schematic or technical drawing of that shows interactions among variables or how something is constructed

value.def: A plot is a secret plan by a group of people to do something that is illegal or wrong, usually against a person or a government.

example.ex: Security forces have uncovered a plot to overthrow the government...
example.tran: 安全部队揭露了一起推翻政府的阴谋。

example.ex: He was responding to reports of an assassination plot against him.
example.tran: 他正就有关针对他的暗杀阴谋的报道作出回应。

value.def: If people plot to do something or plot something that is illegal or wrong, they plan secretly to do it.

example.ex: Prosecutors in the trial allege the defendants plotted to overthrow the government...
example.tran: 检方在审判中指称被告密谋推翻政府。

example.ex: The military were plotting a coup...
example.tran: 军方正在策划一场政变。

example.ex: They are awaiting trial on charges of plotting against the state.
example.tran: 他们因被指控阴谋叛乱而在候审。

value.def: When people plot a strategy or a course of action, they carefully plan each step of it.

example.ex: Yesterday's meeting was intended to plot a survival strategy for the party...
example.tran: 昨天的会议旨在制订使该党能够继续存在下去的策略。

example.ex: For the next five years she plotted her career.
example.tran: 她规划了自己今后5年的职业。

value.def: The plot of a film, novel, or play is the connected series of events which make up the story.
A plot of land is a small piece of land, especially one that has been measured or marked out for a special purpose, such as building houses or growing vegetables.

example.ex: I thought that I'd buy myself a small plot of land and build a house on it...
example.tran: 我想我该给自己买一小块地，在上面建一座房子。

example.ex: The bottom of the garden was given over to vegetable plots.
example.tran: 花园的尽头留作了菜地。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N <l>of</l> n

value.tran: （尤指作特殊用途的）一小块（土地）

value.def: When someone plots something on a graph, they mark certain points on it and then join the points up.

example.ex: We plot about eight points on the graph.
example.tran: 我们在图表上绘制出大约8个点的曲线。

value.def: When someone plots the position or course of a plane or ship, they mark it on a map using instruments to obtain accurate information.

example.ex: We were trying to plot the course of the submarine.
example.tran: 我们试图标绘出潜艇的航线图。

value.tran: （在地图上）标绘出（飞机、船舶的位置或航线）

value.def: If someone plots the progress or development of something, they make a diagram or a plan which shows how it has developed in order to give some indication of how it will develop in the future.

example.ex: They used a computer to plot the movements of everyone in the building.
example.tran: 他们使用了一台计算机绘制这座建筑里每个人的活动图表。

value.def: If someone loses the plot, they become confused and do not know what they should do.

example.ex: The Tories have lost the plot on law and order.
example.tran: 保守党人在治安问题上不知所措。
